points: Developed a MVP platform for learning languages with a module system: courses. theory, dictionaries, interactive trainers and user progress.
The platform itself brings value to the client, not its content — it takes into account user errors and suggests ways to correct them, periodically offering to review forgotten material.
Response time for key pages is under 2 seconds even during high user activity.
Full application delivery cycle: containerization via Docker, setting up nginx and SSL certificate, deployment on a VDS server.
Developed a corporate website and updated the logo and overall design for a construction company, which helped modernize the brand positioning, attract 20 new employees, and one major client.
Solved typical technical issues for employees — from setting up accounts for new hires to resolving complex technical failures.
Together with the head admin, created a web application for efficient processing of employee technical requests. After launch, the time to resolve requests and employee downtime was reduced by half.
The application was also successfully used for outsourced support: it allowed clients to track the number of requests and identify bottlenecks in the IT infrastructure.
Worked with a team of 5 people to develop the client part of two commercial projects: a promo landing page and a corporate website.
Continuously collaborated with the design team to create animations and responsive layouts. Participated in code reviews and tested components using RTL and manual testing.

In both projects, contributed to the development of a preloader mechanism that improves user experience. The mechanism allows loading critical content (photos, videos, etc.) and importing heavy libraries with animations, shaders, and 3D models while the user sees a beautiful loading animation.
During the internship, improved understanding of team processes and worked using the Agile methodology.
